edu.biu.scapi.primitives.dlog
Class ECFpUtility

java.lang.Object
  edu.biu.scapi.primitives.dlog.ECFpUtility

public class ECFpUtility
extends java.lang.Object

This class is a utility class for elliptic curve classes over Fp field. It operates some functionality that is common for every elliptic curve over Fp.

Author:
Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Moriya Farbstein)

Method Detail

checkCurveMembership

public boolean checkCurveMembership(ECFpGroupParams params,
                                    java.math.BigInteger x,
                                    java.math.BigInteger y)
Checks if the given x and y represent a valid point on the given curve, i.e. if the point (x, y) is a solution of the curve’s equation.

Parameters:
params - elliptic curve over Fp parameters
x - coefficient of the point
y - coefficient of the point
Returns:
true if the given x and y represented a valid point on the given curve

findYInCurveEquationForX

public java.math.BigInteger findYInCurveEquationForX(ECFpGroupParams params,
                                                     java.math.BigInteger x)
This function finds the y coordinate of a point in the curve for a given x, if it exists.

Parameters:
params - the parameters of the group
x -
Returns:
the y coordinate of point in the curve for a given x, if it exists else, null

findPointRepresentedByByteArray

public ECFpUtility.FpPoint findPointRepresentedByByteArray(ECFpGroupParams params,
                                                           byte[] binaryString,
                                                           int k)
This function receives any string of size up to k bytes (as returned by CalcK), finds the coordinates of the point that is the encoding of this binary string.

Parameters:
binaryString -
Returns:
an FpPoint with the coordinates of the corresponding GroupElement point or null if could not find the encoding in reasonable time
Throws:
java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the length of the binary array to encode is longer than k

checkSubGroupMembership

public boolean checkSubGroupMembership(DlogECFp curve,
                                       ECFpPoint point)
checks if the given point is in the given dlog group with the q prime order. A point is in the group if it in the q-order group which is a sub-group of the Elliptic Curve. Base assumption of this function is that checkCurveMembership function is already been called and returned true.

Parameters:
curve -
point -
Returns:
true if the given point is in the given dlog group.

mapAnyGroupElementToByteArray

public byte[] mapAnyGroupElementToByteArray(java.math.BigInteger x,
                                            java.math.BigInteger y)
This function maps any group element to a byte array. This function does not have an inverse,

that is, it is not possible to re-construct the original group element from the resulting byte array.

Parameters:
x - coordinate of a point in the curve (this function does not check for membership)
y - coordinate of a point in the curve (this function does not check for membership)
Returns:
byte[] representation

calcK

public int calcK(java.math.BigInteger p)
This function calculates k, the maximum length in bytes of a string to be converted to a Group Element of this group.

Parameters:
p -
Returns:
k

getKLeastSignBytes

public byte[] getKLeastSignBytes(java.math.BigInteger x,
                                 int k)
This function returns the k least significant bytes of the number x

Parameters:
x -
k -
Returns:
k least significant bits of x

checkAndCreateInitParams

public GroupParams checkAndCreateInitParams(java.util.Properties ecProperties,
                                            java.lang.String curveName)
This function receives the name of a curve and some possible properties and it checks that curve is actually a curve over the Fp field. If so, it creates the necessary GroupParams. Else, throws IllegalArgumentException.

Parameters:
ecProperties -
curveName -
Returns:
the GroupParams if this curve is a curve over the Fp field.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if curveName is not a curve over Fp field and doesn't match the DlogGroup type.

getGroupType

public java.lang.String getGroupType()
Returns:
the type of the group - ECFp
